rules: Rule1: If FurnitureCo violates the flame retardant safety standard, then FurnitureCo receives a fine from the regulatory agency.
Rule2: Either FurnitureCo violates the flame retardant safety standard or the forest fire causes damage to natural habitat.
Rule3: If FurnitureCo submits evidence to the regulatory agency, then FurnitureCo files an appeal against the regulatory fine.
Rule4: If FurnitureCo requests a hearing with the regulatory agency, then FurnitureCo submits evidence to the regulatory agency.
Rule5: If a forest fire occurs in a protected region, then the forest fire triggers an investigation of the furniture industry.
Rule6: If a forest fire occurs in a protected region, then the government passes legislation requiring flame retardant standards.
Rule7: If the forest fire triggers an investigation of the furniture industry, then the forest fire causes damage to natural habitat.
Rule8: If FurnitureCo implements the flame retardant requirement standard, then the forest fire causes damage to natural habitat.
Rule9: If FurnitureCo applies for a patent on eco-friendly flame retardant, then FurnitureCo develops a new process for eco-friendly flame retardant.
Rule10: If FurnitureCo hires an environmental lawyer consultant, then FurnitureCo requests a hearing with the regulatory agency.

Rule11: Either FurnitureCo hires an environmental lawyer consultant, or if the absence of forest fire damage to natural habitat does not lead to FurnitureCo failing inspection by the regulatory agency, then FurnitureCo does not receive green manufacturing certification.

Rule12: If it is not the case that FurnitureCo violating the flame retardant safety standard results in FurnitureCo not receiving a fine from the regulatory agency, then FurnitureCo conducts a recall of flame retardant furniture.

Rule13: If it is not the case that the government passing legislation requiring flame retardant standards leads to FurnitureCo implementing the flame retardant requirement standard, then FurnitureCo faces a lawsuit from an environmental group.

Rule14: If it is not the case that the absence of the condition where FurnitureCo violating the flame retardant safety standard results in FurnitureCo not receiving a fine from the regulatory agency leads to FurnitureCo not conducting a recall of flame retardant furniture, then FurnitureCo applies for a patent on eco-friendly flame retardant.

Rule15: If it is not the case that the absence of the condition where FurnitureCo violating the flame retardant safety standard results in FurnitureCo not receiving a fine from the regulatory agency leads to FurnitureCo not conducting a recall of flame retardant furniture, then FurnitureCo does not develop a new process for eco-friendly flame retardant.
Rule16: If the absence of forest fire damage to natural habitat does not lead to FurnitureCo failing inspection by the regulatory agency, then FurnitureCo receives green manufacturing certification.
Rule17: If the forest fire does not cause damage to natural habitat, then FurnitureCo passes inspection by the regulatory agency.
facts: Fact1: A forest fire occurs in a protected region.
Fact2: FurnitureCo does not face a lawsuit from an environmental group.
Fact3: FurnitureCo does not file an appeal against the regulatory fine.

question: The forest fire causes damage to natural habitat.
